info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 3:51AM EST until January 13 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, wet snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 7 inches or more possible along and north of Route 28. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northern Herkimer County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 PM EST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will fall at elevations greater than 1500 feet. Snowfall rates of 1 inch per hour are possible this morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
